instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the fof opcode for formant synthesis
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

; Function tables
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1
giSigRise ftgen 2, 0, 1024, 19, 0.5, 0.5, 270, 0.5

instr 1
    ; fof opcode: ares fof xamp, xfund, xform, koct, kband, kris, kdur, kdec, iolaps, 
    ;                 ifna, ifnb, itotdur [, iphs] [, ifmode] [, iskip]
    ; fof generates formant wave functions (formant-wave-function synthesis)
    ; xamp - amplitude
    ; xfund - fundamental frequency (Hz)
    ; xform - formant frequency (Hz)
    ; koct - octaviation index (typically 0)
    ; kband - bandwidth of formant (Hz)
    ; kris - rise time as fraction of duration
    ; kdur - overall duration of grain (seconds)
    ; kdec - decay time as fraction of duration
    ; iolaps - maximum number of overlaps
    ; ifna - grain shape function
    ; ifnb - window function
    ; itotdur - total duration for FOF
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Fundamental frequency
    kFund = 120
    
    ; Single formant (vowel "ah" F1)
    kForm = 730
    kOct = 0
    kBW = 80
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Generate FOF
    aFOF fof kAmp, kFund, kForm, kOct, kBW, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    
    out aFOF
endin

instr 2
    ; Multiple formants for vowel synthesis
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    kFund = 150
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Vowel "ah" formants
    kF1 = 730
    kF2 = 1090
    kF3 = 2440
    
    kBW1 = 80
    kBW2 = 90
    kBW3 = 120
    
    ; Generate three formants
    aF1 fof kAmp*0.5, kFund, kF1, kOct, kBW1, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    aF2 fof kAmp*0.3, kFund, kF2, kOct, kBW2, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    aF3 fof kAmp*0.15, kFund, kF3, kOct, kBW3, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    
    ; Mix formants
    aVowel = aF1 + aF2 + aF3
    
    out aVowel*0.7
endin

instr 3
    ; Vowel morphing
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.4, p3-0.1, 0.4, 0.05, 0
    
    kFund = 140
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Morph from "ah" to "ee"
    ; "ah": F1=730, F2=1090, F3=2440
    ; "ee": F1=270, F2=2290, F3=3010
    kMorph linseg 0, p3, 1
    
    kF1 = 730 + (270-730)*kMorph
    kF2 = 1090 + (2290-1090)*kMorph
    kF3 = 2440 + (3010-2440)*kMorph
    
    kBW1 = 80
    kBW2 = 90
    kBW3 = 120
    
    aF1 fof kAmp*0.5, kFund, kF1, kOct, kBW1, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    aF2 fof kAmp*0.3, kFund, kF2, kOct, kBW2, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    aF3 fof kAmp*0.15, kFund, kF3, kOct, kBW3, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    
    aVowel = aF1 + aF2 + aF3
    
    out aVowel*0.6
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play single formant
i1 0 2

; Play vowel "ah"
i2 2.5 2

; Play vowel morph
i3 5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the fof2 opcode for advanced formant synthesis
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function tables
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1
giSigRise ftgen 2, 0, 1024, 19, 0.5, 0.5, 270, 0.5

instr 1
    ; fof2 opcode: ares fof2 xamp, xfund, xform, koct, kband, kris, kdur, kdec, iolaps,
    ;                  ifna, ifnb, itotdur, kphs, kgliss [, iskip]
    ; fof2 is like fof but with phase and glissando control
    ; xamp - amplitude
    ; xfund - fundamental frequency
    ; xform - formant frequency
    ; koct - octaviation index
    ; kband - bandwidth
    ; kris, kdur, kdec - grain shape times
    ; iolaps - maximum overlaps
    ; ifna, ifnb - function tables
    ; itotdur - total duration
    ; kphs - phase offset (0-1)
    ; kgliss - glissando coefficient
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    kFund = 150
    kForm = 800
    kOct = 0
    kBW = 90
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Phase offset for stereo spread
    kPhs = 0
    kGliss = 0  ; No glissando
    
    aFOF fof2 kAmp*0.4, kFund, kForm, kOct, kBW, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
              giSine, giSigRise, p3, kPhs, kGliss
    
    outs aFOF, aFOF
endin

instr 2
    ; Glissando formant effect
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    kFund = 120
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Formant with glissando
    kForm = 600
    kBW = 80
    kPhs = 0
    kGliss = 0.7  ; Glissando effect
    
    aF1 fof2 kAmp*0.4, kFund, kForm, kOct, kBW, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
             giSine, giSigRise, p3, kPhs, kGliss
    
    outs aF1, aF1
endin

instr 3
    ; Stereo formants with phase offset
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    kFund = 140
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Two formants with different phase
    kForm1 = 700
    kForm2 = 1200
    kBW = 85
    kGliss = 0
    
    ; Left channel: phase 0
    aLeft fof2 kAmp*0.35, kFund, kForm1, kOct, kBW, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
               giSine, giSigRise, p3, 0, kGliss
    
    ; Right channel: phase 0.5 (opposite phase)
    aRight fof2 kAmp*0.35, kFund, kForm2, kOct, kBW, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
                giSine, giSigRise, p3, 0.5, kGliss
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 4
    ; Singing formant with vibrato and glissando
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Vibrato on fundamental
    kVib oscili 4, 5.5, giSine
    kFund = 180 + kVib
    
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Vowel "oh" formants
    kF1 = 570
    kF2 = 840
    kF3 = 2410
    kBW1 = 80
    kBW2 = 85
    kBW3 = 110
    
    kPhs = 0
    kGliss = 0.3
    
    aF1 fof2 kAmp*0.5, kFund, kF1, kOct, kBW1, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
             giSine, giSigRise, p3, kPhs, kGliss
    aF2 fof2 kAmp*0.3, kFund, kF2, kOct, kBW2, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
             giSine, giSigRise, p3, kPhs, kGliss
    aF3 fof2 kAmp*0.15, kFund, kF3, kOct, kBW3, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
             giSine, giSigRise, p3, kPhs, kGliss
    
    aVowel = aF1 + aF2 + aF3
    
    outs aVowel*0.6, aVowel*0.6
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic fof2
i1 0 2

; Play glissando
i2 2.5 3

; Play stereo formants
i3 6 3

; Play singing formant
i4 9.5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the fofilter opcode for formant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; fofilter opcode: ares fofilter asig, kcf, kris, kdec [, istor]
    ; fofilter filters a signal through FOF-like formant filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency (formant frequency in Hz)
    ; kris - impulse rise time (seconds)
    ; kdec - impulse decay time (seconds)
    ; istor - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 150, 0
    
    ; Single formant filter
    kFormant = 800
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec = 0.02
    
    ; Apply formant filter
    aFilt fofilter aSaw, kFormant, kRis, kDec
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Vowel filtering with multiple fofilters
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Buzz source (vocal cord simulation)
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 120, 40, giSine
    
    ; Vowel "ah" formants
    kF1 = 730
    kF2 = 1090
    kF3 = 2440
    
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec1 = 0.02
    kDec2 = 0.015
    kDec3 = 0.01
    
    ; Apply three formant filters
    aForm1 fofilter aBuzz, kF1, kRis, kDec1
    aForm2 fofilter aBuzz, kF2, kRis, kDec2
    aForm3 fofilter aBuzz, kF3, kRis, kDec3
    
    ; Mix with appropriate levels
    aVowel = aForm1*0.6 + aForm2*0.3 + aForm3*0.15
    
    outs aVowel, aVowel
endin

instr 3
    ; Dynamic formant sweeping
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 0
    
    ; Sweep formant frequency
    kFormant expseg 300, p3, 2500
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec = 0.015
    
    aFilt fofilter aSaw, kFormant, kRis, kDec
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; Vowel morphing with fofilter
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Pulse source
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.3, 140, 2, 0.5
    
    ; Morph from "ee" to "oo"
    ; "ee": F1=270, F2=2290
    ; "oo": F1=300, F2=870
    kMorph linseg 0, p3, 1
    
    kF1 = 270 + (300-270)*kMorph
    kF2 = 2290 + (870-2290)*kMorph
    
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec = 0.018
    
    aForm1 fofilter aPulse, kF1, kRis, kDec
    aForm2 fofilter aPulse, kF2, kRis, kDec*0.8
    
    aVowel = aForm1*0.7 + aForm2*0.3
    
    outs aVowel, aVowel
endin

instr 5
    ; Talking drum effect
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Noise burst (drum hit)
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.5, 0
    aExcite = aNoise * (1 - linseg(0, 0.03, 1, 0.001, 1))
    
    ; Varying formant simulates talking
    kFormant linseg 400, p3*0.3, 800, p3*0.4, 600, p3*0.3, 1000
    kRis = 0.002
    kDec = 0.025
    
    aFilt fofilter aExcite, kFormant, kRis, kDec
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play single formant
i1 0 2

; Play vowel "ah"
i2 2.5 3

; Play sweep
i3 6 4

; Play vowel morph
i4 10.5 4

; Play talking drum
i5 15 1.5
i5 16 1.5
i5 17 1.5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the resonz opcode for narrow-band formant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; resonz opcode: ares resonz asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; resonz is a narrow-band bandpass filter useful for formants
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency (Hz)
    ; kbw - bandwidth (Hz)
    ; iscl - scale flag (1=no scaling, 2=peak response of 1)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 165, 0
    
    ; Single formant filter
    kCenter = 900
    kBW = 50
    iScl = 2  ; Peak response of 1
    
    ; Apply resonant filter
    aFilt resonz aSaw, kCenter, kBW, iScl
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Vowel synthesis with multiple resonz filters
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Buzz source
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 140, 35, giSine
    
    ; Vowel "eh" formants
    kF1 = 530
    kF2 = 1840
    kF3 = 2480
    
    kBW1 = 60
    kBW2 = 90
    kBW3 = 120
    
    ; Apply formant filters
    aForm1 resonz aBuzz, kF1, kBW1, 2
    aForm2 resonz aBuzz, kF2, kBW2, 2
    aForm3 resonz aBuzz, kF3, kBW3, 2
    
    ; Mix with formant amplitude levels
    aVowel = aForm1*0.6 + aForm2*0.35 + aForm3*0.15
    
    outs aVowel, aVowel
endin

instr 3
    ; Formant sweeping for vocal effects
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Square wave source
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 2
    
    ; Sweep two formants in opposite directions
    kF1 linseg 400, p3, 1200
    kF2 linseg 1800, p3, 800
    
    kBW1 = 70
    kBW2 = 90
    
    aForm1 resonz aSq, kF1, kBW1, 2
    aForm2 resonz aSq, kF2, kBW2, 2
    
    ; Stereo output
    outs aForm1*0.6, aForm2*0.6
endin

instr 4
    ; Parallel formant bank for rich timbre
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.3, 0
    
    ; Create five formant peaks
    kF1 = 350
    kF2 = 700
    kF3 = 1050
    kF4 = 1400
    kF5 = 1750
    
    kBW = 40  ; Narrow bandwidth
    
    aForm1 resonz aNoise, kF1, kBW, 2
    aForm2 resonz aNoise, kF2, kBW, 2
    aForm3 resonz aNoise, kF3, kBW, 2
    aForm4 resonz aNoise, kF4, kBW, 2
    aForm5 resonz aNoise, kF5, kBW, 2
    
    ; Mix all formants
    aOut = (aForm1 + aForm2 + aForm3 + aForm4 + aForm5) * 0.4
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 5
    ; Modulated formant for robot voice
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    
    ; LFO modulates formant positions
    kLFO oscili 200, 0.5, giSine
    
    kF1 = 600 + kLFO
    kF2 = 1200 + kLFO*1.5
    kF3 = 2400 + kLFO*0.8
    
    kBW1 = 50
    kBW2 = 70
    kBW3 = 100
    
    aForm1 resonz aSaw, kF1, kBW1, 2
    aForm2 resonz aSaw, kF2, kBW2, 2
    aForm3 resonz aSaw, kF3, kBW3, 2
    
    aRobot = aForm1*0.5 + aForm2*0.3 + aForm3*0.2
    
    outs aRobot, aRobot
endin

instr 6
    ; Vocal tract resonance on percussive sound
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aImp mpulse kAmp*0.5, 0
    
    ; Formant filtering creates pitched percussion
    kFormant = p4
    kBW = 30
    
    aFilt resonz aImp, kFormant, kBW, 2
    
    ; Add some comb filtering
    aFilt = aFilt + comb(aFilt, 1.5, 1/kFormant)
    
    outs aFilt*0.5, aFilt*0.5
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play single formant
i1 0 2

; Play vowel "eh"
i2 2.5 3

; Play formant sweep
i3 6 4

; Play formant bank
i4 10.5 3

; Play robot voice
i5 14 4

; Play pitched percussion
i6 18.5 1 440
i6 19.5 1 550
i6 20.5 1 660

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates advanced vowel synthesis combining fof and resonz opcodes
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function tables
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1
giSigRise ftgen 2, 0, 1024, 19, 0.5, 0.5, 270, 0.5

instr 1
    ; Complete singing voice with FOF formants
    kAmp madsr 0.03, 0.15, 0.7, 0.4
    
    ; Vibrato
    kVib oscili 3, 5.8, giSine
    kFund = p4 + kVib
    
    ; FOF parameters
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    ; Vowel formant frequencies from p5
    ; 1="ah", 2="eh", 3="ee", 4="oh", 5="oo"
    if p5 == 1 then
        kF1 = 730
        kF2 = 1090
        kF3 = 2440
    elseif p5 == 2 then
        kF1 = 530
        kF2 = 1840
        kF3 = 2480
    elseif p5 == 3 then
        kF1 = 270
        kF2 = 2290
        kF3 = 3010
    elseif p5 == 4 then
        kF1 = 570
        kF2 = 840
        kF3 = 2410
    else
        kF1 = 300
        kF2 = 870
        kF3 = 2240
    endif
    
    kBW1 = 80
    kBW2 = 90
    kBW3 = 120
    
    ; Generate formants with FOF
    aF1 fof kAmp*0.5, kFund, kF1, kOct, kBW1, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    aF2 fof kAmp*0.35, kFund, kF2, kOct, kBW2, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    aF3 fof kAmp*0.2, kFund, kF3, kOct, kBW3, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    
    ; Add singer's formant around 3kHz
    aF4 fof kAmp*0.1, kFund, 3200, kOct, 150, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
            giSine, giSigRise, p3
    
    aVoice = aF1 + aF2 + aF3 + aF4
    
    ; Add breath noise
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.015, 0
    aBreath resonz aNoise, 2000, 500, 2
    
    aOut = aVoice*0.7 + aBreath*0.3
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 2
    ; Hybrid synthesis: FOF + resonz filtering
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    kFund = 180
    
    ; Generate base formant with FOF
    kOct = 0
    kRis = 0.003
    kDur = 0.02
    kDec = 0.007
    iOlaps = 100
    
    aBase fof kAmp*0.4, kFund, 500, kOct, 100, kRis, kDur, kDec, iOlaps, \
              giSine, giSigRise, p3
    
    ; Apply additional resonz filters for spectral shaping
    aFilt1 resonz aBase, 1200, 80, 2
    aFilt2 resonz aBase, 2500, 120, 2
    
    aOut = aBase*0.6 + aFilt1*0.25 + aFilt2*0.15
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Singing melody with different vowels
; Format: start dur fund vowel
; Vowels: 1=ah, 2=eh, 3=ee, 4=oh, 5=oo

; "ah" vowel
i1 0 1.5 220 1
i1 1.5 1.5 247 1
i1 3 2 262 1

; "eh" vowel
i1 5.5 1.5 220 2
i1 7 1.5 247 2

; "ee" vowel
i1 9 2 262 3

; "oh" vowel
i1 11.5 1.5 196 4
i1 13 2 220 4

; "oo" vowel
i1 15.5 2 165 5

; Hybrid synthesis
i2 18 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
